item.title: Linux Fedora meets Windows User
item.description:
My Experience Switching to Linux (Fedora)

To start, I was quite happy with Windows, but I’ve become increasingly annoyed by their pushy and sneaky ways of forcing users into their ecosystem. I accidentally activated Co-Pilot, and boy oh boy, how annoying is that? It reminded me of their infamous Clippy. So, when Linux-related videos started popping up in my YouTube recommendations, I thought, “Why not give it a try?”

Getting Started with Linux

If you’ve never tried Linux before, I highly recommend starting with Linux Mint Cinnamon. It looks and feels like Windows—I even installed it on an old laptop for my parents, and they didn’t even notice they were now Linux users! Alternatively, Ubuntu is a great beginner-friendly option; it was my first Linux experience.
